repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Fixes #5411, needed for using pickle with cython3 on NumPy

The basic premise is that a failure in `__getattr__` should raise an `AttributeError`

comment_data.body: `ModuleNotFoundError` is python3.6+, before that it was `ImportError`. The harder problem is the `from None` which is not available in python2.7
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -565,7 +565,10 @@ def __init__(self, module):
     def __getattr__(self, item):
         if item.startswith('__') and item.endswith('__'):
             raise AttributeError(item)
-        return __import__(item)
+        try:
+            return __import__(item)
+        except ModuleNotFoundError:
+            raise AttributeError(item) from None

@@ -565,7 +565,10 @@ def __init__(self, module):
     def __getattr__(self, item):
         if item.startswith('__') and item.endswith('__'):
             raise AttributeError(item)
-        return __import__(item)
+        try:
+            return __import__(item)
+        except ModuleNotFoundError:
+            raise AttributeError(item) from None

comment_data.body: I think I found a solution without exec
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -565,7 +565,10 @@ def __init__(self, module):
     def __getattr__(self, item):
         if item.startswith('__') and item.endswith('__'):
             raise AttributeError(item)
-        return __import__(item)
+        try:
+            return __import__(item)
+        except ModuleNotFoundError:
+            raise AttributeError(item) from None

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3str`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: raise AttributeError inside __getattr__
